title: 550.31 CREDITOR TO RECORD ORDER WITH COUNTY RECORDER.
text: For the purpose of such redemption a creditor whose claim against the estate of a decedent shall have been so allowed shall record in the office of the county recorder of the county in which the real estate sought to be redeemed is situated, within the year of redemption, a certified copy of the order of the court allowing such claim, and thereupon such claim shall constitute a lien upon the unexempt real estate of the decedent sold upon foreclosure or execution. The creditor shall also within such time file a notice in the office of such county recorder briefly describing the sale of the decedent's lands, a description of the lands sold, and stating, in a general way, the nature, date and amount of the claim of the creditor, and that the creditor intends to redeem such lands from the sale thereof described in such notice. In the case of redemption from execution sales such notice shall also be filed in the office of the court administrator of the district court in which such lands are situated.
